document.heading: Housing Finance Agency Loan Forgiveness Amendment Act of 1996

history.narrative: Law 11-197, the “Housing Finance Agency Loan Forgiveness Amendment Act of 1996,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-537, which was referred to the Committee on Housing and Urban Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 4, 1996, and July 3, 1996, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 26, 1996, it was assigned Act No. 11-359 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-197 became effective April 9, 1997.
